topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55650a47636872354dbe3c00#post_55650a47636872354dbe3c00
[bq="mariomarc"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5565088d63687256787e0400#post_5565088d63687256787e0400
WE SHALL INHERIT THE EARTH[/bq]
What's funny is that I'm being serious here about them taking over.

Comic book superheroes are the big blockbusters now.  There's a couple adaptations of anime franchises in the works; chances are in say ten years there will be as many adaptations of anime franchises as there are superhero films if the couple in the works pay off.  Star Wars is back.  Star Trek is back in production.  There was the Halo tv show.  The list goes on really; when you get down to it the geek subculture is so popular now that it's starting to bring in more money per movie than even a lot of popular non-geek franchises.

Tl:dr; "Geeky" things are bringing over a hundred billion dollars annually.
